taskman

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.Frontend.UserInterface

  • public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the user interface of the taskman program.
    Author:
    Julien Benaouda, Jeroen Van Der Donckt

    • Method Detail

      • welcomeDialog

        public void welcomeDialog()
        Prints the welcome dialog

      • showUserChoiceDialog

        public void showUserChoiceDialog()
        Shows a dialog where a user type can be chosen.
        Postcondition:
        the user type is set to the specified type.

      • showMainMenu

        public void showMainMenu()
        Shows the main menu of the program and lets the user chose an option. If the user enters a non valid number, the menu is shown again.

      • showSystemTime

        public void showSystemTime()

      • listProjects

        public void listProjects()
        Prints the list of projects. Only the project names are printed.

      • importFile

        public void importFile()
        Lets the user import a path to an xml file and converts that xml file into project data.
        Postcondition:
        all system and project data is restored from the xml file.

      • exportFile

        public void exportFile()
        Exports all system and project data to a file with the entered path
        Postcondition:
        all system and project data is exported to an xml file.

      • showProjectMenu

        public void showProjectMenu()
        lets the user enter a project.

      • showProjectMenu

        public void showProjectMenu(java.lang.String name)
        Shows the project menu for a given project and let's the user choose an option.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the project to show options for.

      • addAlternative

        public void addAlternative(java.lang.String name)
        Adds an alternative to a task of a project
        Parameters:

                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • createTask

        public void createTask(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a task for the given project.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the project to create the task for
        Postcondition:
        a new task is created and added to the given project

      • updateTaskStatus

        public void updateTaskStatus(java.lang.String name)
        Updates the task status of an available task of the given project.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the project
        Postcondition:
        a task status, start time and end time of the selected available task of the given project is updaten

      • createProject

        public void createProject()
        creates a new project
        Postcondition:
        a new project is created in the system with the entered parameters.

      • advanceSystemTime

        public void advanceSystemTime()
        Advances the system time to the new time.
        Postcondition:
        the system time is set to the entered time.
